topics.body:
"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/547a85f563687251cf840100#post_547a85f563687251cf840100
A sandwich is the ultimate for of food expression. It can be as basic or as extravagent as the maker wants. Between two slices of bread hold infinite possibilities.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/547a85d36368722fc80d0000#post_547a85d36368722fc80d0000
The BLT does certainly deserve pride of place, but my heart will ever belong to that delicious combination of swiss, pastrami, russian dressing and sauerkraut served on rye and lightly grilled till all is a melted mass of scrumptious deliciousness.

Again though, this is not to denigrate the BLT at all, when properly prepared with a bag of salt and vinegar chips and pickle on the side there are few more delicious dishes. However I've always found that the BLT is very much a slave to the quality of the ingredients, a single wilted leaf of lettuce or bacon cooked to anything other than crisp, crunchy perfection can utterly ruin the experience for me.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

topics.body:
"@mariomarc":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/547a87df6368722469e60200#post_547a87df6368722469e60200
You don't have to really, an ordinary ham and cheese or pb&j can be perfectly satisfying and those take less than five minutes to prepare, but I advise you, and all people, to once in awhile take some time to make yourself a truely excellent sandwich. Believe me, nothing is more relaxing than sitting down to veg out on the TV or internet with a nice French Dip, or Pulled Pork sandwich.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7
